query:
-- Insert sample pillars INSERT INTO pillars (slug, name, description) VALUES ('mind', 'Mind', 'Explore topics related to mental health, productivity, and personal growth.'), ('body', 'Body', 'Discover insights about physical health, fitness, and wellness.'), ('soul', 'Soul', 'Connect with content about spirituality, purpose, and inner peace.'); -- Insert sample articles INSERT INTO articles (slug, title, subtitle, author, pillarId, featuredImageUrl, richTextBody, metaDescription, isFeatured, publishedAt) VALUES ('meditation-for-beginners', 'Meditation for Beginners: A Complete Guide', 'Start your meditation journey with practical tips and techniques', 'Sarah Chen', 3, 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1506126613408-eca07ce68773?w=800', '

Getting Started with Meditation

Meditation is a powerful practice that can transform your mental and emotional well-being. Whether you''re looking to reduce stress, improve focus, or simply find inner peace, meditation offers a path forward.

The Basics

Begin with just 5-10 minutes daily. Find a quiet space, sit comfortably, and focus on your breath. When your mind wanders, gently bring it back to your breathing.

Benefits

  • Reduced anxiety and stress
  • Improved focus and concentration
  • Better emotional regulation
  • Enhanced self-awareness

Remember, meditation is a practice. Be patient with yourself as you develop this habit.

', 'Learn meditation basics and start your mindfulness journey today', 1, '2024-10-20 10:00:00'), ('strength-training-essentials', 'Strength Training Essentials: Build a Stronger You', 'Master the fundamentals of effective strength training', 'James Wilson', 2, 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1534438327276-14e5300c3a48?w=800', '

Why Strength Training Matters

Strength training is essential for building muscle, increasing metabolism, and improving overall health. It''s never too late to start.

Key Principles

  1. Progressive Overload: Gradually increase weight or reps
  2. Proper Form: Quality over quantity
  3. Consistency: Train 3-4 times per week
  4. Recovery: Allow muscles to rest and repair

Getting Started

Begin with bodyweight exercises or light weights. Focus on compound movements like squats, deadlifts, and bench presses. Consider working with a trainer initially to learn proper form.

', 'Build strength and muscle with proven training principles', 1, '2024-10-18 14:30:00'), ('productivity-hacks', 'Top 10 Productivity Hacks for Remote Workers', 'Maximize your output and minimize distractions while working from home', 'Emma Rodriguez', 1, 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552664730-d307ca884978?w=800', '

Working Smarter, Not Harder

Remote work offers flexibility, but it also requires discipline. Here are proven strategies to boost your productivity.

Essential Hacks

  1. Time Blocking: Schedule specific tasks for dedicated time blocks
  2. The Pomodoro Technique: Work for 25 minutes, then take a 5-minute break
  3. Minimize Notifications: Turn off distracting alerts
  4. Create a Dedicated Workspace: Separate work from leisure
  5. Morning Routine: Start your day with intention

Tools That Help

Consider using project management tools like Asana, Notion, or Monday.com to stay organized and on track.

', 'Boost your remote work productivity with these proven strategies', 1, '2024-10-15 09:15:00'), ('nutrition-myths', 'Common Nutrition Myths Debunked', 'Separate fact from fiction in the world of nutrition', 'Dr. Michael Park', 2, 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1490645935967-10de6ba17061?w=800', '

Setting the Record Straight

The nutrition world is full of myths and misconceptions. Let''s debunk some of the most common ones.

Myth 1: Carbs Are Bad

False! Complex carbohydrates are essential for energy and brain function. The key is choosing whole grains over refined carbs.

Myth 2: Fat Makes You Fat

Not true. Healthy fats are crucial for hormone production and nutrient absorption. Focus on sources like avocados, nuts, and olive oil.

Myth 3: Skipping Meals Helps Weight Loss

This can actually slow your metabolism. Regular, balanced meals keep your energy stable and metabolism active.

The Bottom Line

Balance, variety, and moderation are key to healthy nutrition. Consult with a registered dietitian for personalized advice.

', 'Learn the truth about common nutrition myths and misconceptions', 1, '2024-10-12 11:45:00'), ('finding-purpose', 'Finding Your Purpose: A Practical Guide', 'Discover your life''s direction and meaning', 'Lisa Thompson', 3, 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1506126613408-eca07ce68773?w=800', '

The Quest for Purpose

Finding your purpose is one of the most rewarding journeys you can undertake. It gives direction to your life and meaning to your actions.

Self-Reflection Questions

  • What activities make you lose track of time?
  • What problems in the world do you want to solve?
  • What values are most important to you?
  • How do you want to be remembered?

Steps to Discovery

  1. Explore your passions and interests
  2. Identify your core values
  3. Consider how you can serve others
  4. Experiment and iterate
  5. Align your work with your purpose

Remember

Purpose often evolves over time. Be patient with yourself and remain open to new possibilities.

', 'Discover your life purpose through reflection and exploration', 1, '2024-10-10 16:20:00');
